column1: Mtsensk (Russian: Мценск) is a town in Oryol Oblast

column1: It was first mentioned in the Nikon Chronicle in 1146 as a part of the Principality of Chernigov. The name comes from the Mtsena River

column5: it was under the rule of Lithuania
column6: eventually becoming a part of the Muscovy in 1505. Since the beginning of the 19th century
column7: Mtsensk was rapidly developing as an industrial town.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
